sn35.154:1.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and asked him,
sn35.154:1.2: “Sir, they speak of someone who is ‘accomplished regarding the faculties’.
sn35.154:1.3: How is someone accomplished regarding the faculties defined?”
sn35.154:2.1: “Mendicant, if someone meditates observing rise and fall in the eye faculty, they grow disillusioned with the eye faculty.
sn35.154:2.2: If they meditate observing rise and fall in the ear faculty … nose faculty … tongue faculty … body faculty …
sn35.154:2.3: mind faculty, they grow disillusioned with the mind faculty.
sn35.154:2.4: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. … When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
sn35.154:2.5: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
sn35.154:2.6: This is how someone who is accomplished regarding the faculties is defined.”
